title: NASA’s Hubble Sees Aftermath of Galaxy’s Scrape with Milky Way
summary: A story of survival is unfolding at the outer reaches of our galaxy, and NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope is witnessing the saga. The Large Magellanic Cloud, also called the LMC, is one of the Milky Way galaxy’s nearest neighbors. This dwarf galaxy looms large on the southern nighttime sky at 20 times the apparent diameter […]

title: Telescope for NASA’s Roman Mission Complete, Delivered to Goddard
summary: NASA’s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope is one giant step closer to unlocking the mysteries of the universe. The mission has now received its final major delivery: the Optical Telescope Assembly, which includes a 7.9-foot (2.4-meter) primary mirror, nine additional mirrors, and supporting structures and electronics. The assembly was delivered Nov. 7. to the largest […]

title: AI takes aim at tedious tasks in government contracting
summary: The newer generation of AI tools is specifically designed to navigate the complex world of government contracting, where security protocols are strict and the stakes are high, as a single proposal can make or break a company's fiscal year.

title: The Exploration Company Tests Nyx Thermal Protection System
summary: The Exploration Company has completed key testing of thermal protection materials that will be used in the thermal protection system of its Nyx Earth space capsule. Nyx Earth is a reusable space capsule that will initially transport cargo to and from the International Space Station, with an estimated cost of $150 million per flight. In […]

title: China launches first Haiyang-4 oceanography satellite
summary: HELSINKI — China conducted its 55th orbital launch of 2024, sending the Haiyang-4 (01) oceanography satellite into a near polar orbit. A Long March 4B rocket lifted off at 5:42 […]

title: ESA signs contracts advancing Greece’s Earth observation capabilities
summary: Today, the European Space Agency signed six contracts that will help position Greece as a key player in the field of Earth observation.

title: Denmark signs Artemis Accords
summary: Denmark is the latest country to john the Artemis Accords, the 48th country to sign the document outlining best practices for sustainable space exploration.

title: Rocket Lab signs first Neutron launch customer
summary: Rocket Lab says it has signed the first customer for its Neutron launch vehicle as the company pushes towards a mid-2025 first launch of the vehicle.

title: Space for Inspiration: shaping new markets beyond Earth
summary: ESA invites you to join its fifth Space for Inspiration conference on the future of commercial space exploration in Luxembourg on 4 and 5 December.

title: SpaceX launches 24 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The mission is scheduled less than six hours after another Starlink launch from California. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 8:21 a.m. EST (1321 UTC).
